meanings.definition: A type of shrub or small tree with clusters of white or pink flowers.
meanings.sent1: The viburnum in the garden bloomed beautifully this spring.
meanings.sent2: I planted a viburnum bush in my backyard for its lovely flowers.
meanings.sent3: The viburnum in the yard danced in the breeze, showing off its pretty blooms.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as bright and delicate as a viburnum flower.
meanings.sent5: The fragrance of the viburnum filled the air, creating a peaceful atmosphere.

meanings.definition: The fruit of the viburnum plant, resembling a small berry.
meanings.sent1: I picked some viburnum from the bush to make jam.
meanings.sent2: The birds enjoy feasting on the viburnum berries in the fall.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel stole the viburnum berries for its secret stash.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the sweet taste of viburnum berries on a summer day.
meanings.sent5: The vibrant red viburnum berries added a pop of color to the garden.

meanings.definition: The wood of the viburnum plant, used for making tools or furniture.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter crafted a beautiful table from viburnum wood.
meanings.sent2: The sturdy viburnum wood was perfect for building a new cabinet.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat scratched the viburnum wood, leaving tiny marks.
meanings.sent4: The viburnum wood gleamed in the sunlight, showcasing its natural beauty.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly cut viburnum wood filled the workshop, creating a pleasant work environment.
